title: Subscription Payment Refunded
description: Identify this event with the HTTP POST parameter `alert_name` with a value of `subscription_payment_refunded`

alert_id.title: Alert ID
alert_id.description: The unique identifier for this Paddle webhook alert. Integer value sent as a string.

amount.description: The amount refunded, partial refunds are possible. Decimal value sent as a string.

balance_currency.title: Balance Currency
balance_currency.description: The three letter ISO currency code of the vendor’s default currency at the time of the transaction. Eg: `USD`, `GBP`.

balance_earnings_decrease.title: Balance Earnings Decrease
balance_earnings_decrease.description: The amount of revenue taken from the vendor’s balance as a result of this refund, in the vendor’s `balance_currency` at the time of the transaction. It returns a positive or negative value. Eg: If you issue a VAT-only refund, this will increase the vendor’s earnings instead of decreasing it, to reflect this we use a negative value. Please also note that if the earnings of the order being refunded are being split between vendors, the earnings decrease amount will not include the other vendor’s fee, only yours. (eg. If you are giving 15% of your earnings to another vendor and keeping 85%, your balance earnings will be reduced only by 85%).

balance_fee_refund.title: Balance Fee Refund
balance_fee_refund.description: The fee amount returned to the vendor, in the vendor’s `balance_currency` at the time of the transaction.

balance_gross_refund.title: Balance Gross Refund
balance_gross_refund.description: The total amount returned to the customer as a result of this refund, in the vendor’s `balance_currency` at the time of the transaction.

balance_tax_refund.title: Balance Tax Refund
balance_tax_refund.description: The amount of tax returned to the customer, in the vendor’s `balance_currency` at the time of the transaction.

checkout_id.title: Checkout ID
checkout_id.description: The checkout id of the order created.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code. Eg: `USD`, `GBP`. See [Supported Currencies](/reference/platform-parameters/supported-currencies).

earnings_decrease.title: Earnings Decrease
earnings_decrease.description: The amount of revenue taken from the vendor’s earnings as a result of this refund, in the currency of the original transaction. It returns a positive or negative value. E.g: if you issue a VAT-only refund, this will increase the vendor’s earnings instead of decreasing it, to reflect this we use a negative value. Please also note that if the earnings of the order being refunded are being split between vendors, the earnings decrease amount will not include the other vendor’s fee, only yours: for example if you are giving 15% of your earnings to another vendor and keeping 85%, your balance earnings will only be reduced by 85%.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the customer.

event_time.title: Event Time
event_time.description: The date and time the event was triggered in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).

fee_refund.title: Fee Refund
fee_refund.description: The fee amount returned to the vendor, in the currency of the original transaction.

gross_refund.title: Gross Refund
gross_refund.description: The total amount returned to the customer as a result of this refund, in the currency of the original transaction.

initial_payment.title: Initial Payment
initial_payment.description: The value of this field `0` or `1` indicates whether it is the customer’s first payment for this subscription.

instalments.title: Instalments
instalments.description: Number of payments made to date, starting from `1` for the customer's first payment. Integer sent as string.

marketing_consent.title: Marketing Consent
marketing_consent.description: The value of this field `0` or `1` indicates whether the user has agreed to receive marketing messages from the vendor.

order_id.title: Order ID
order_id.description: The Paddle Order ID for this payment. This can be used to look up the order within your Seller Dashboard.

passthrough.title: Passthrough
passthrough.description: This field contains any values that you passed into the checkout using the `passthrough` parameter. See the [Pass Parameters documentation](/guides/how-tos/checkout/pass-parameters#sending-additional-user-data) for more information.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of products or subscription seats sold in the transaction.

status.title: Status
status.description: This is the current status of the subscription. A list of possible values and their meanings can be found under [Event Statuses](/reference/platform-parameters/event-statuses).

subscription_id.title: Subscription ID
subscription_id.description: This is the unique Subscription ID for this customer’s subscription. You should store this with the customer in your database, as it is needed for making API calls.

subscription_payment_id.title: Subscription Payment ID
subscription_payment_id.description: The unique ID of the subscription payment.

subscription_plan_id.title: Subscription Plan ID
subscription_plan_id.description: The ID of the Subscription Plan the customer is subscribed to. (This is the value that will change upon plan change).

tax_refund.title: Tax Refund
tax_refund.description: The amount of tax returned to the customer, in the currency of the original transaction.

unit_price.title: Unit Price
unit_price.description: The price per unit of the subscription.

p_signature.title: P Signature
p_signature.description: This field contains an encrypted token that you can use to verify the request authenticity. See [Verifying Webhooks](/webhook-reference/verifying-webhooks).
